body.p:
Maysville Kentucky
26 of novr 1861
To the Honble Beriah Magoffin

John L Scott Esqr will hand you two petitions one of Brookover, the other of Hasson; pardon me for expressing my hope that you will remit the fines against Brookover, his care I deem one where executive Clemency should be exercised -- his petiton is signed among others by Mr Mca'Tee the owner of the slave, Hasson is a poor ignorant Drayman, having a family and in these times can hardly "make tongue and buckle meet"
I hope if the Legislature gives a Bill of sale of Kentucky to Lincoln & Co, that it will will contain no Covenant of Warrantee.
